article.headline: Ball St. 61, Valparaiso 40
article.story: MUNCIE, Ind. (AP) -- Anthony Newell scored 13 points and grabbed nine rebounds to lead Ball State to a 61-40 win over Valparaiso on Saturday. Peyton Stovall added 10 points for the Cardinals (4-6) who snapped a two-game losing streak and won for the second time in the last eight games. Urule Igbavboa had 10 points and 10 rebounds to lead the Crusaders (3-6) in their sixth straight loss. Brandon McPherson added 10 points for Valparaiso but committed seven turnovers. The Crusaders finished with 22 turnovers which the Cardinals turned into 17 points. Newell scored 10 of his points during a 17-8 first-half run in which Valparaiso shot just 3-of-11 from the floor. The Crusaders finished 15-of-46 (32 percent) from the field. A 3-pointer by Stovall with 4:14 left in the game capped a 13-4 run for the Cardinals and gave them a 24-point lead, their largest of the game. Ball State outrebounded Valparaiso 36-29 and outscored the Crusaders in second-chance points 15-2 and in the paint, 30-20.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
